newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: CANTV confirm Venezuela Thursday strike.
newsitem.headline: CANTV confirm Venezuela Thursday strike.

text.p: Union leaders of workers of national telephone company CANTV confirmed Wednesday their intention to start an indefinite walkout on Thursday, although CANTV officials said they still hope a strike could be averted.
"The strike starts at seven o'clock tomorrow," Audio Rincon, general secretary of the Federation of Telecommunications Workers (Fetratel) told Reuters.
Rincon said the 29 unions, which Fetratel represents had the legal go-ahead to carry out the strike, which is over pay.
But a negotiator for CANTV said the company was still hopeful of heading off the strike.
"We hope to reach an agreement soon. We're close and optimistic," said the company source.
The source said unions had lowered their pay demands from 156 percent to less than 140 percent.
